@pineyzb yea looks so, and yes I can understand that it's effective and appropriate at times... Not once today tho.
Island teams generally don't have structure or patience or discipline to keep shape for 90minutes
My experience in the islands is that with enough controlled possession, switching of play in back and middle third, you can break teams down
I'm all for playing long when required, but surely we have the talent to play through the thirds at times as well? Mix it up?
So how's that lumping it long to Chris Wood working out? Smh
@pineyzb what about middle third? We never try and play through even if midfielders in great positions to receive and turn!
@andrew_garbett he'll definitely be feeling sorry for himself! Let his team down for sure. Congrats to the Naki! Away trip!!
@andrew_garbett @WKAFC bit rough Garbs! Very good development minded coach
@NZPhotomac not next week, 20th! If Napier & Miramar drop points next week we good tho
@UMobileSoccer really? 😍
While coach can give advice it is much more powerful for the players to notice what is happening in a game and work/communicate to affect it
One of many lessons from the tournament for these lads is that they are youth players and THEY must now take ownership of their team play.
Our final game saw us go down 5-1. Obviously not a great performance but plenty to learn from! especially HOW to notice + react to problems
Game 5 vs Apia Leichardt was exciting! Boys played well, showed good improvement from our last game! 1-1 and nearly snuck it! @CapFootball
Boys still very positive, having a great time and learning heaps. ⚽️👌🏼 @CapFootball
2nd game vs Blacktown Spartans we played nice stuff but a series of mistakes saw us go down 5-1, goal a free-kick from Luca @CapFootball
First game v Northern Tigers saw us win 1-0 with a well taken goal by Aidan Rodriguez. @CapFootball
Mixed day for the 03 boys with weather warm and some rotation in the squad due to niggles and also to further challenge some. @CapFootball
